column1: Gueiren District (Chinese: 歸仁區; Hanyu Pinyin: Guīrén Qū; Tongyong Pinyin: Gueirén Cyu; Wade–Giles: Kui1-jen2 Ch'ü1; Pe̍h-ōe-jī: Kui-jîn-khu) is a rural district in southern Tainan
After the handover of Taiwan from Japan to the Republic of China in 1945
column2: Rende was organized as a rural township of Tainan County. On 25 December 2010
column3: Tainan County was merged with Tainan City and Rende was upgraded to a district of the city.

column1: The local economy is based mainly on agriculture
column4: starfruit and guavas. It also houses the Shalun Smart Green Energy Science City.
